portsIn.name: Text
portsIn.value: This setting is required so that users can send your token to each other. It's best to enable it before setting up any trust lines or issuing any tokens.

portsIn.name: Text
portsIn.value: This setting limits your tokens to being held only by accounts you've explicitly approved. You cannot enable this setting if you already have any trust lines or offers for any token.

portsIn.name: Style

portsOut.name: TriggerFail
portsOut.value: Triggered if error code doesn't match

portsIn.name: Text
portsIn.value: Enable if you process withdrawals of your token to outside systems. (For example, your token is a stablecoin.)

portsIn.name: Text
portsIn.value: Enable if this address isn't meant to process XRP payments.

portsIn.name: Text
portsIn.value: Transfer Fee - Charge a percentage fee when users send your token to each other. Recommended Value 0–1%.

portsIn.name: Text
portsIn.value: Tick Size - Limit the number of decimal places in exchange rates for your token in the decentralized exchange. A tick size of 5-6 reduces churn of almost-equivalent offers and speeds up price discovery compared to the default of 15. Recommended Value 5

portsIn.name: Text
portsIn.value: Domain - Set to a domain you own so can verify ownership of the accounts. This can help reduce confusion or impersonation attempts.

portsIn.name: Text
portsIn.value: Select the account that you want to send the tokens to once they are issued.

portsIn.value: When set, the account cannot be the destination for any incoming PaymentChannel transactions.

portsIn.value: When this flag is set, the account cannot be the destination for any trust lines (also known as credit lines).
